scenarioDescription:
The 47 UMa Exoplanetary System


Overview

47 UMa is a star with 1.06 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.21 times its radius. It is located 45.00 light years away from the solar system.

47 UMa is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the 47 UMa system


47 UMa b

47 UMa b was discovered by the Lick Observatory observatory, in 1996-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 47 UMa b is 804.540 times the mass of Earth. The radius of 47 UMa b is 13.200 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 47 UMa b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


47 UMa c

47 UMa c was discovered by the Lick Observatory observatory, in 2002-01, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 3.60 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 47 UMa c is 171.720 times the mass of Earth. The radius of 47 UMa c is 14.200 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 47 UMa c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


47 UMa d

47 UMa d was discovered by the Lick Observatory observatory, in 2010-04, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 11.60 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 47 UMa d is 521.520 times the mass of Earth. The radius of 47 UMa d is 13.500 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 47 UMa d is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system 47 UMa, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the Lick Observatory.
name: 47 UMa - System With 3 Exolanets
